    Function to connect RNA-seq data and genome annotation data

    make_final_table.Rd

    This function merges RNA-seq count data with genome annotation information from a GTF file. It selects one random transcript per gene and summarizes exon information along with average gene expression across multiple RNA-seq samples.

    make_final_table(data_dir, gtf_filename, ctrl_filenames, output_filename)

    Arguments

    data_dir

    Path to the folder containing input data files.

    gtf_filename

    Filename of the genome annotation GTF file (e.g., "Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.114.gtf.gz").

    ctrl_filenames

    A character vector of RNA-seq count filenames.

    output_filename

    Full path for the output Excel file.

    Value

    Writes an Excel file containing summarized exon and expression data. Also returns the resulting data frame invisibly.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
make_final_table(
  data_dir = "path/to/data_directory",
  gtf_filename = "your_annotation_file.gtf.gz",
  ctrl_filenames = c(
    "sample1_counts.tab.gz",
    "sample2_counts.tab.gz",
    "sample3_counts.tab.gz"
  ),
  output_filename = "path/to/output/final_table.xlsx"
)
} # }
